etymology.description: 汽(汽) (qì, "steam; vapor") + 水(水) (shuǐ, "water") = water with vapor -> sparkling water
etymology.interpretation: The word 汽水 (qìshuǐ) combines 汽(汽) (qì, "steam; vapor") and 水(水) (shuǐ, "water"), suggesting water that contains bubbles of gas or vapor, typical of sparkling water. This aptly describes fizzy water beverages.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢喝汽水(我喜歡喝汽水)。
examples.english: I like to drink sparkling water.

examples.chinese: 夏天很热(夏天很熱)，一瓶汽水可以消暑(一瓶汽水可以消暑)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàtiān hěn rè, yī píng qìshuǐ kěyǐ xiāoshǔ.
examples.english: It is very hot in summer, and a bottle of sparkling water can cool you down.
